question: In which of the following years the Indian Government, Maharaja Ranjit Singh, and Shah Shuja signed a treaty at Lahore?
explanation: The Indian Government, Maharaja Ranjit Singh, and Shah Shuja signed a treaty at Lahore (three allies) on 26th June 1838. According to the treaty the first two promised to help Shah Shuja capture power in Afghanistan and, in return, Shah Shuja promised not to enter into negotiations with any foreign state without the consent of the British and the Punjab Governments.
